holidays.name: World Turtle Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate and raise awareness about turtles and tortoises, promoting their protection and conservation worldwide.
holidays.origin: Started in 2000 by American Tortoise Rescue to honor these slow-moving reptiles and their vulnerable status.
holidays.funFact: Turtles have been around for over 200 million years—longer than dinosaurs! So they’ve survived some pretty crazy times.

holidays.name: National Lucky Penny Day (USA)
holidays.description: A quirky day to appreciate the humble penny, especially if you find one heads-up—it’s supposed to bring you good luck!
holidays.origin: An unofficial American tradition celebrating the superstition surrounding lucky pennies.
holidays.funFact: Some people collect pennies from certain years believing they carry special luck or memories from that time.

holidays.name: International Day to End Obstetric Fistula
holidays.description: A global health awareness day aimed at ending obstetric fistula, a serious childbirth injury affecting millions of women in developing countries.
holidays.origin: Established by the United Nations in 2013 to promote maternal health and surgical interventions.
holidays.funFact: Obstetric fistula can often be prevented with timely medical care, but stigma causes many women to suffer in silence.

holidays.name: World Otter Day
holidays.description: A delightful day to celebrate otters, those playful aquatic mammals known for holding hands and cracking open shellfish with rocks.
holidays.origin: Started by the Otter Project to raise awareness about the species’ conservation challenges.
holidays.funFact: Sea otters have a favorite rock they carry around in a pouch under their arm to break open shells—talk about a handy tool!

holidays.name: Can-Can Dance Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the high-energy French dance famous for its high kicks, frilly skirts, and a dash of rebellious spirit!
holidays.origin: Commemorates the lively dance that emerged in 19th-century Parisian cabarets like the Moulin Rouge.
holidays.funFact: Originally, the can-can was considered scandalous because of the dancers’ high kicks and daring moves—it was quite the social rebellion!
